silence.translation[0].definitions[0].de: complete absence of sound or noise
silence.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: After the explosion, an eerie silence fell upon the scene.
A loud scream shattered the silence.
Nothing disturbed the silence of the night.
silence.translation[0].definitions[1].de: complete quiet because nobody is talking
silence.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
The accused exercised his right to silence (=the legal right to choose to say nothing).
‘How long have you been here?’ I asked. There was complete silence.
There was an awkward silence between them.
The four men sat in silence.
silence.translation[0].definitions[2].de: failure or refusal to discuss something or answer questions about something
silence.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Once again the answer was a deafening silence (=a very noticeable refusal to discuss something).
The government’s silence on such an important issue seems very strange.
silence.translation[0].definitions[3].de: failure to write a letter to someone, telephone them etc
silence.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: After two years of silence, he suddenly got in touch with us again.
silence.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The silence in the room was absolute.
There was a gasp from Peter and then a dead silence.
‘He’s dead.’ There was a long silence.
After a brief silence, Katherine nodded.
‘Fred tells me you like books, ’ Steve said, after an awkward silence.
There was a stunned silence at the other end of the phone.
Harrison stared at him in stony silence.
There was a brief, tense silence.
An eerie silence descended over the house.
‘How long will she be ill?’ There was a short, ominous silence.
At the mention of John, a sudden silence fell on the room.
There was silence in the library for several moments.
The sound of a car engine broke the silence.
Nothing moved, no sound disturbed the silence.
A sudden silence fell over the room.
'I don't want any, ' he said, and lapsed into silence again.
silence.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make someone stop talking, or stop something making a noise
silence.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: She held up her hand to silence the children.
silence.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to make someone stop expressing opposition or criticisms – used especially in news reports
silence.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Barnes has failed to silence his critics.
